newsitem.title: NORWAY: NYCOMED IN POSSIBLE 230 MLN NOK TAX DISPUTE.
newsitem.headline: NYCOMED IN POSSIBLE 230 MLN NOK TAX DISPUTE.

text.p: Norwegian drugs company Nycomed ASA, which plans to merge with Britain's Amersham International Plc soon, said on Thursday it was contesting a possible 230 million crown tax claim.

"The Norwegian tax authorities have at the end of July 1997 again raised a question about the tax treatment of shipping investments made by Hafslund Nycomed at the end of the 1980s," the company said in a statement accompanying its half-year result.

Nycomed, which used to be part of combined drugs and energy company Hafslund Nycomed, said an adjusted tax assessment could result in a tax claim of up to 230 million crowns, excluding possible interest and penalty tax charges.
"The accounts as of June 30 do not include an accrual for a possible tax claim. Nycomed maintains that the accounting and tax treatment of these investments is correct," the statement said.
